docs.snippet: A federal judge has issued court orders that prevent Missouri police from stopping media and others from recording officers....

headline.main: Judge: Missouri Police Can't Stop Media Recordings
headline.print_headline: Judge: Missouri Police Can't Stop Media Recordings

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has issued court orders that prevent Missouri police from stopping media and others from recording officers.

docs.snippet: A Florida polo club founder was sentenced to 16 years in prison on Friday after a jury for a second time found him guilty of killing a recent college graduate in a collision while driving drunk late one night in Palm Beach County....

headline.main: Florida Polo Magnate Gets 16 Years for Deadly Drunken Driving Crash
headline.print_headline: Florida Polo Magnate Gets 16 Years for Deadly Drunken Driving Crash

docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida polo club founder was sentenced to 16 years in prison on Friday after a jury for a second time found him guilty of killing a recent college graduate in a collision while driving drunk late one night in Palm Beach County.

docs.snippet: Isn’t the rule that no one has to cook anything over Thanksgiving week that isn’t for Thanksgiving?...

headline.main: Soaking Cranberries, and Heading Into Thanksgiving Week

docs.abstract: Isn’t the rule that no one has to cook anything over Thanksgiving week that isn’t for Thanksgiving?

docs.snippet: A lawyer for a former University of Miami pitching coach is seeking a wide range of Major League Baseball records for the coach's upcoming trial on illegal performance-enhancing drug distribution charges, including details of an immunity deal give...

headline.main: Ex-Coach's Lawyer Seeks MLB Records in Drug Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Coach's Lawyer Seeks MLB Records in Drug Case

docs.lead_paragraph: A lawyer for a former University of Miami pitching coach is seeking a wide range of Major League Baseball records for the coach's upcoming trial on illegal performance-enhancing drug distribution charges, including details of an immunity deal given to the New York Yankees' Alex Rodriguez.

docs.snippet: Turkey and the United States played down differences in the fight against Islamic State on Friday, but Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu made clear Ankara would keep pressing for a no-fly zone in Syria and President Bashar al-Assad's removal....

headline.main: Turkey, U.S. Play Down Differences on Fight Against Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Turkey, U.S. Play Down Differences on Fight Against Islamic State

docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey and the United States played down differences in the fight against Islamic State on Friday, but Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu made clear Ankara would keep pressing for a no-fly zone in Syria and President Bashar al-Assad's removal.

docs.snippet: Darren Wilson, the officer who fatally shot 18-year-old Michael Brown in August, is reportedly in talks with Ferguson city officials about resigning from the police department....

headline.main: Officer Darren Wilson Said to Have No Plans to Return to Ferguson Police

docs.abstract: Darren Wilson, the officer who fatally shot 18-year-old Michael Brown in August, is reportedly in talks with Ferguson city officials about resigning from the police department.

docs.snippet: Iran and the United States have intensified efforts to overcome deep divisions in talks on Tehran's nuclear program days ahead of a deadline for agreement. Pavithra George reports....

headline.main: U.S., Iran in last-ditch bid to clinch historic nuclear deal
headline.sub: U.S., Iran in last-ditch bid to clinch historic nuclear deal

docs.lead_paragraph: Iran and the United States have intensified efforts to overcome deep divisions in talks on Tehran's nuclear program days ahead of a deadline for agreement. Pavithra George reports.

docs.snippet: The Virginia Supreme Court has refused to hear the appeal of a former University of Virginia lacrosse player convicted of killing his ex-girlfriend....

headline.main: Virginia High Court Rejects Lacrosse-Case Appeal
headline.print_headline: Virginia High Court Rejects Lacrosse-Case Appeal

docs.lead_paragraph: The Virginia Supreme Court has refused to hear the appeal of a former University of Virginia lacrosse player convicted of killing his ex-girlfriend.

docs.snippet: The day's top showbiz news and headlines including Enrique Iglesias wins three Latin Grammys, Glenn Close returns to Broadway, and "The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 1" takes in 17 million at early screenings. Bob Mezan reports....

headline.sub: Iglesias wins at Latin Grammys, Glenn Close back on Broadway

docs.lead_paragraph: The day's top showbiz news and headlines including Enrique Iglesias wins three Latin Grammys, Glenn Close returns to Broadway, and "The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 1" takes in 17 million at early screenings. Bob Mezan reports.
